Sri Mulyani akan Investigasi 'Desa Tanpa Penduduk' yang Tergiur Dana Desa
04 Nov 2019, 21:54 by Magdalena


Sri Mulyani akan Investigasi 'Desa Tanpa Penduduk' yang Tergiur Dana Desa

KBRN, Jakarta : Kementerian Keuangan mengindikasikan munculnya ‘desa-desa baru tanpa penduduk’ hanya untuk mendapatkan aliran dana desa dari pemerintah.
“Kami mendapatkan masukkan, karena sekarang ada transfer yang ajeg dari APBD, maka sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang bahkan tidak ada penduduknya, hanya untuk mendapatkan dana desa,” ujar Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati dalam Raker dengan Komisi XI DPR RI, Senin (4/11/2019).
“Maka kami ingin melakukan verifikasi terhadap munculnya fenomena tersebut, karena mereka melihat adanya  jumlah uang yang ditransfer setiap tahunnya,” sambung Menkeu.
Menurutnya, meski transfer dana daerah terus dilakukan setiap tahun dan penyerapannya relatif stabil, tapi sampai saat ini masih ada sekira 20. 000 desa yang masih masuk dalam katagori desa tertinggal.
Menurut data Kementerian Keuangan, hingga bulan September 2019, realisasi dana desa sudah mencapai 42,2 triliun rupiah atau mencapai 62,9 persen.
Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani lebih lanjut mengatakan, sebenarnya ada mekanisme dalam pembentukan desa serta untuk mengindentifikasi siapa pengurusnya. Hal itu untuk mencegah agar dana desa tidak tersalurkan ke pihak yang tidak berhak.

Sri Mulyani will investigate 'Villages without Residents' who were tempted by Village Funds
Nov. 04 2019, 21:54 by Magdalena


Sri Mulyani will investigate 'Villages without Residents' who were tempted by Village Funds

KBRN, Jakarta: The Ministry of Finance indicates the emergence of 'new villages without inhabitants' just to get the flow of village funds from the government.
"We have entered, because now there is a steady transfer from the APBD, so now new villages are emerging that even have no inhabitants, only to get village funds," Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati said in a meeting with the House of Representatives Commission XI, Monday ( 11/4/2019).
"So we want to verify the emergence of this phenomenon, because they see the amount of money being transferred each year," continued the Minister of Finance.
According to him, although the transfer of regional funds continues to be carried out every year and the absorption is relatively stable, but until now there are still approximately 20,000 villages that are still included in the category of underdeveloped villages.
According to Ministry of Finance data, as of September 2019, the realization of village funds has reached 42.2 trillion rupiah or reaching 62.9 percent.
Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani further said that there was actually a mechanism in the formation of villages as well as to identify who the management was. This is to prevent village funds from being channeled to unauthorized parties.
